DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess and determine the influence of pelvic inclination on sit to stand task in stroke patients.
DOC.brief_title: Relationship Between Pelvic Tilt and Sit to Stand Task in Stroke Patients
DOC.detailed_description: There is a crucial need to have a better understanding of effect of pelvic inclination on sit to stand activity and to know the important factors to be considered to improve the patients' treatment and performance. sixty participants are recruiting to assess the pelvic tilt angles in stroke patients during sitting position and to analyze the influence of pelvic tilt angles on ability to perform sit to stand task during rising from a chair in stroke patients.
DOC.criteria: Patients' age range from 3560 years old. Normal body weight with a body mass index (BMI) ranges from 18.5 to 24.9 kg/m2. Patients' will have the ability to maintain sitting position without using any aids. Cooperative patients with ability to understand instructions and follow simple verbal commands. The duration of illness will be from six months to 5 years. The degree of lower limb spasticity will be ranged between (1:1+) according to the Modified Ashworth Scale. History of previous strokes and other neurological disorders. Visual, auditory and vestibular deficits. Cognitive impairments and language deficits. Leg length discrepancy is more than 0.5 cm. Previous history of orthopedic conditions in back or lower limbs (e.g. low back pain, fractures, deformities and surgeries).
